name: Bamboo
description: Bamboo is the basic building block for castaway construction. It's strong, versatile, and goes well with the whole island milleu.

name: Driftwood
description: Most driftwood is not native to the island. Like you, it drifted here from some far off land.

name: Palm Frond
description: There are exactly 1001 uses for palm fronds, but if you discover a new one, then the number will be bumped up to 1002.

name: Jade
description: Jade describes several different kinds of stone, most of which have a supple green color that can be shaped into valuable ornamental knickknacks.

name: Gold
description: Gold is a beautiful and malleable metal thet has been used as currency for thousands of years.

name: Pokeberry
description: This berry that gives so muchâ€¦ like intense vomitting and brilliant purple lips.

name: Message in a Bottle
description: This is a bottle.

name: Vine
description: Swinging on vines can lead to injury; fastening them to things is much safer.

name: Manchineel Fruit
description: The manchineel tree is entirely poisonous, including its fruit, bark, and leaves. Treat with extreme caution.

name: Privet
description: Ripe privet berries are so delicious, you can almost taste the purple.

name: Banana Leaf
description: Banana leaves are useful for quick rain cover, and they don't stain your hands like newspaper.

name: Rattan
description: Unlike bamboo, rattan is not hollow and it needs to climb other plants in order to maintain growth.

name: Cannonball Fruit
description: The perfurmed fragrance of this tree's flowers belie the poisonous nature of its toxic fruit.

name: Softwood
description: Softwood is pliable, easy to harvest and shape.

name: Nautilus Shell
description: Primitive island cultures often used shells as money. To this day, there are some island where two "nauts" will still buy you a shrimp and pepper gyro.

name: Large Clam Shell
description: According to a recent Clam poll, 87% of those questioned say they prefer their shells be used for festive decorations, and only posthumously.

name: Ash
description: Ash is the noncombustible remains of fire, often containing potent blends of valuable, nonbiological nutrients.

name: Mandrake Root
description: Forever associated with magic, mandrake root rates a 10 of the Fumigato Scale of Creepiness.

name: Sundial Shell
description: These naturally straight shells only curl when exposed to water.

name: Grass
description: Great for lawns, roofs, and casual grazing.

name: Yellow Hibiscus
description: Homesick castaways often tie yellow hibiscus around palm trees as an expression of their loneliness.

name: Treasure Map Piece
description: The faded markings on this tattered shred of paper look suspiciously map-like.

name: Pearl
description: Pearls are layered, like onions, and the more layers a pearl has, the more difficult it is to find out what's really bothering it.

name: Orange Hibiscus
description: The orange hibiscus flower is copmmonly used to celebrate a marriage that no one expects to last.

name: White Hibiscus
description: White hibiscus are best worn before Labor Day, any later would be gauche.

name: Red Hibiscus
description: During winter holidays, red hibiscud makes a festive alternative to poinsettias.

name: Indigo Leaf
description: Although used by some cultures to ease pain, indigo leaves are primarily used to make beautiful purple dyes.

name: Stone
description: Carefully crafted by millions of years of caustically erosive meteorogical and geological activity, loose stones are great for breaking things.

name: Sisal
description: Sisalogists have long debated the aesthetic implications of this durable fabric.

name: Clay
description: Red clay is an effective dying material, sometimes dying clothes against a person's best efforts to remain clean.

name: Chicken Feather
description: Although not considered suitable for haute couture, chicken feathers nevertheless have their place as pillow stuffing and feet tickling material.

name: Physic Nut
description: Another fun-filled poisonous plant. The physic nut may be cooked in order to remove of its toxicity.

name: Cotton
description: Its soft absorbency makes cotton an ideal fabric for delicates and unmentionables.

name: Metal Ore
description: An essential ingredient of civilization, the refining of ore has helped us make remarkable advances in toasting bread.

name: Ti Leaves
description: Ti Leaves have been traditionally used as part of clothing creation and decoration.

name: Obsidian
description: Most people learn everything they need to know about this highly useful volcanic rock at events called Show & Tell.

name: Twine
description: If you find the need to bind, just unwind a bit of twine.

name: Boar Tusk
description: It's important to have the right tool for the job, or in this case, the right tusk for the task.

name: Glass
description: Artisans learned to change the porperties of glass by adding materials like metal oxides and chocolate chips.

name: Iris Flower
description: Put a twig of this plant in your pocket, and the luck of the iris will always be with you.

name: Orange Dye
description: Orange the fruit was named long before orange the color, leading some to believe that useless trivia like this is best left unsaid.

name: Hardwood
description: This resilient wood is the ultimate in both style and durability for crafting.

name: Fine Sand
description: Fine sand is much more valuable than budget sand

name: Squid Ink
description: Sailors of yore used squid ink to document their shanties, and now you can too.

name: Red Orchid
description: When red orchids bloom, even roses stop to smell them.

name: Soap Plant
description: If it wasn't for this one miracle plant, your hygiene would be yet another unfortunate casualty of the shipwreck.

name: Yellow Dye
description: Yellow is a bright and optimistic color, best suited for kitchens, solariums, and teeth.

name: Purple Dye
description: Deep, royal, and long overdue for a comeback, this could be purple's breakout moment.

name: Sandalwood
description: Wooden sandals are not carved from sandalwood, which is ironic given its inherent odor-eating fragrance.

name: Leather
description: Boar leather may seem a bit "renaissance faire", but its practical uses are too many to ignore.

name: Kukui Nut
description: Like most other nuts, the kukui doesn't fall far from the tree.

name: Blue Orchid
description: Blue orchids are so delicate, an unkind word may cause them to wither.

name: Pink Orchid
description: The aroma of pink orchids is often mistaken for cheap bubble gum.

name: Purple Orchid
description: Only the most virile bees dare attempt to pollinate the voluptuous purple orchid.

name: White Orchid
description: Ancient housewives used white orchids to dispel the evil spirits emanating from their husbands after a long hunt.

name: Black Dye
description: Even under the unforgiving island sun, basic black still goes with everything.

name: Brown Dye
description: Brown dye is a constant delight, hiding stains and telling the fashion world that you no longer care.

name: Shark Tooth
description: Be careful when handling a shark tooth - you never know where that thing has been.

name: Shark Leather
description: Sharks were once docile, good humored animals until people started making shoes out of them.

name: Cowry Shell
description: Early tribal accountants fashioned the first abacus out of strings of cowry shells.

name: Rope
description: When you reach the end of your rope, tie it off and weave a new one.

name: Moonstone
description: Moonstone appear in a multitude of colors, none of which look like the moon.

name: Blue Dye
description: Looking to turn something blue? Then this is the dye for you.

name: Iris Root
description: Most magic potions require a pinch of iris root. Too bad you never studied potions.

name: Cockle Shell
description: With their heart-shaped bivalve structure, cockles are the love lockets of the sea.

name: Mitre Shell
description: Prehistoric mitre shells measured 20 cubits in length, and were covered in shaggy fur.

name: Radio Antenna
description: This antenna has broken off the main radio at certain welding points, but its core electrical system remains remarkably intact.

name: Red Dye
description: Red is the color of rage and war, or yummy strawberries, depending on your mood.

name: Death Daisy
description: The nature of this flower remains mysterious, but its petals seem to have captured the spirit of a departed person.

name: Death Daisy Potion
description: Before the advent of Death Daisy Potion, reanimating the dead was reserved for gods and mad scientist.

name: Coconut
description: Due to their ubiquitous island presence, it's convenient to be crazy for coconuts.

name: Starfruit
description: With its lemony plum taste, starfruits are usually reserved for the most sophisticated palates.

name: Rumberry
description: "Yo, ho, ho, and a bottle of rumberry cider" was later shortened to make pirates seem tougher.

name: Banana
description: If you lonely for someone to talk to hold a banana to your ear and pretend it's a telephone.

name: Raspberry
description: Not to be confused with a Bronx Cheer, this tangy berry is a compliment to almost any meal.

name: Cherry
description: Cherries are the only fruit that when gathered correctly, can congeal into an actual jubilee.

name: Snowberry
description: Fans of this fruit insist there's no berry like snowberry.

name: Blackberry
description: Be they pureed into jam or mixed into war paint, the blackberry is a resourceful little fruit.

name: Grapefruit
description: Grapefruit offer a soup reprieve from the syrupy sweetness of most tropical fruit.

name: Pineapple
description: Pineapples are neither pine trees nor apples. They are technically berries and delicious.

name: Papaya
description: The papaya, or chichihaultzapotl as it's known in Nahuatl, is a tasty treat any time of day.

name: Guava
description: With a little ingenuity, this nutritious fruit can be whipped into a delicious guava gravy.

name: Cantaloupe
description: According to Melon Monthly Magazine, cantaloupes are "good eating".

name: Lychee Fruit
description: Lychees are easy to candy, and make a great piÃ±ata stuffer.

name: Breadfruit
description: The rind of a breadfruit is also called the crust.

name: Mangosteen
description: Nothing is more refreshing than a cold grass of mangosteenade.

name: Peach
description: Tender is the peach. Seriously, they bruise easily so be gentle.

name: Tangerine
description: An ideal fruit for making marmalade, assuming you happen upon some pectin.

name: Date
description: Make an appointment to eat this rich-textured fruit, and you've got a date with a date.

name: Blood Orange
description: Caution: Gorging on blood oranges may result in a crime scene of hemorrhaged crimson juices.

name: Mango
description: Too much of this flavorsome fruit and you risk developing a case of Mango Madness.

name: Lime
description: Limes contain flavonol glycosides which help prevent cancer and (in sufficient supply) forest fires.

name: Lemon
description: A lemon day keeps scurvy away, which means you will need to find another way to make money.

name: Watermelon
description: A large succulent melon with a thick rind that can double as a decent jack-o-lantern substitute.

name: Persimmon
description: As the saying goesâ€¦ for healthier livin', eat a daily persimmon.

name: Strawberry
description: Unlike the endless expanse of space, strawberry fields are not forever - so harvest sparingly.

name: Cucumber
description: Even if served hot, there's still just something cool about a cucumber.

name: Long Bean
description: Long beans generally get better jobs than short beans.

name: Almond Nut
description: One bite of this crunchy nut and it's easy to see why almonds are the world's best friend.

name: Yam
description: Shamans of some cultures imbue yams with magical properties, others imbue it wih butter and brown sugar.

name: Bell Pepper
description: These aren't your normal garden variety bell peppers. Oh wait, yes they are.

name: Soybean
description: Whether cooked, curdled, or milked - this is one versatile bean.

name: Taro Root
description: Taro is one of the first yucky foods ever cultivated, upsetting children for thousands of years.

name: Wheat
description: In spite of its dull brown husk, wheat remains the world's most boring food.

name: Brazil Nut
description: Freaky Fact: Brazil nuts are actually grown all over South America.

name: Carrot
description: The beta-carotene in carrots is great for your eyes, but only if administered orally and not optically.

name: Rice
description: Rice has been a staple for billions of years. It's widely believed that dinosaurs made a kicking etouffee.

name: Tomato
description: Perfect for salads, sauces, and throwing at terrible public performers.

name: Corn
description: Any way you shuck it, this grain is aMAIZEing.

name: Onion
description: When onions are cut, they release a gas that turns your tears into a diluted form of sulphuric acid. Awesome!

name: Pumpkin
description: Pumpkins are actually fruit because they grow from a flower, but no one really cares.

name: Avocado
description: This grenade-shaped veggie packs an explosion of rich buttery zest.

name: Rosemallow Root
description: Rosemallow plants may grow to eight feet tall, and contain many nonspecific but promising medicinal qualities.

name: Macamadia Nut
description: The question of whether or not this is a tasty nut is purely Macademic.

name: Cashew Nut
description: For a taste of home, try a cashew butter and jelly sandwich.

name: Guarana
description: Guarna seeds act as a natural stimulant, giving early man a way to stay alert while hammering bigger rocks with smaller rocks.

name: Ginger
description: Chewing a bit of ginger helps freshen your breath, and that is something everyone can root for.

name: Chili Pepper
description: Ancient and modern people both use chilies to disguise awful cooking and royal poisonings.

name: Sugar Cane
description: "No cane, no gain" is a way of life for those who swear by an all-sugar diet.

name: Tumeric Root
description: Tumeric root gives any meal a colorful curry kick.

name: Garlic
description: Island vampires may be rarity, but it's still wise to have few cloves nearby just in case.

name: Honeycomb
description: Honeycombs are labyrinths of tiny spaces, not unlike an office full of cubicles.

name: Coffee Bean
description: An American scientist invented 3000 uses for the coffee bean, including the ill-fated coffee butter, now used as road tar.

name: Cocoa
description: Some believe that chocolate is itself a god, but theologians generally reject the feasibility of an edible cosmology.

name: Clam Meat
description: Clams are bi-valve mollusks that bury themselves in the sand and capture drifting plankton.

name: Moray Eel
description: The moray eel is a flavourful eel that must be prepared properly to dispose of its poisonous skin.

name: Freshwater Eel
description: Don't let its freshwater innocence fool you, this anguilliformes comes from a house of eel repute.

name: Alien Food
description: Colonels Yylarg's Gourmet Space Slurry. Now with 20% more Blarg Mjark!

name: Chicken
description: Few things can be turned into nuggets, thankfully chicken meat is one of them.

name: Egg
description: The noble egg. Fruit of a chicken's posterior.

name: Mackerel
description: The mackerel is a long and slender fish that migrates from north to south, depending on the season and discount rates.

name: Sardine
description: Their massive numbers and tiny houses have these fish packed in like sardines.

name: Mullet
description: This fish is built short in the front and long in the back.

name: Black Carp
description: Get inside this fish's mind to truly understand the world according to carp.

name: Copper Rockfish
description: Elderly copper rockfish eventually develop a green patina.

name: Flying Fish
description: Once airborne, the flying fish uses its spotfin control lift and drag.

name: Blacktail Wrasse
description: When provoked, blacktail wrasse release an invisible cloud of spit.

name: Chilipepper
description: The chilipepper is spectacularly ugly fish with a large underbite and tiny, unimpressive fins.

name: Turkeyfish
description: What would Thanksgiving dinner for a castaway be without a big roasted turkeyfish and seaweed dressing?

name: Redfish
description: Redfish are striped with two identical shades of red.

name: Chicken Grunt
description: Chicken grunt taste more like grunt than chicken.

name: Starry Rockfish
description: Schoold of starry rockfish are known to swim in constellation formations.

name: Large Mouth Bass
description: This fish is named for both its oversized orifice, and its reputation as an underwater gossip.

name: Jackfish
description: Until you meet this little swimmer face to face, you don't know jackfish.

name: Channel Catfish
description: Catfish use their deadly hypno-purr to subdue unsuspecting prey into sleepy submission.

name: Goatfish
description: These stubborn fish enjoy butting heads, and would lock horns if they had any.

name: Mangrove Snapper
description: Behind every great mangrove snapper, there's a great womangrove snapper.

name: Yellowtail Rockfish
description: These rockfish are born with a nasty case of yellowtail, yet go on to live perfectly normal lives.

name: Tarpon
description: Every time the tide recedes, a tarpon earns its fins.

name: Speckled Grouper
description: After eons of evolution, this grouper has grown from freckled to speckled.

name: Bream
description: For this little fish, life is but a bream.

name: Bicolor Parrot Fish
description: Despite their name, parrot fish do not make suitable shoulder companions.

name: Monkeyface Prickleback
description: Most Monkeyface Pricklebacks resent their colloquial name, and prefer cebidichthys violaceus instead.

name: Rainbow Runner Salmon
description: During the Great War, rainbow runner served as carrier pigeons for the navy.

name: Rainbow Trout
description: At the end of every rainbow trout is a pot of fishy gold.

name: Meteor Perch
description: The meteor perch is a horizontally striped fish that has nothing whatsoever to do with meteors, hence its name.

name: Boccaccio
description: Boccaccio are a gullible fish that fall for anything hook, line, and sinker.

name: Cowcod
description: On this deserted island, you could be waiting for rescue until the cowcods come home.

name: Widow Rockfish
description: Ever since she lost her husband, the Widow Rockfish has never been quite the same.

name: Barracuda
description: Barracuda mate for life, or at least until domething better swims along.

name: Striped Bass
description: Horizontal stripes make this bass look fat; vertical would have been much more sliming.

name: Red Snapper
description: The red snapper is a shy fish that earns its name by perpetually blushing.

name: Albacore Tuna
description: This high brow tuna is known in the fish world for its snappy dressing and droll humor.

name: Yellowtail Snapper
description: Without its jaunty yellow tail, this snapper would be duller than a dial tone.

name: Black Rockfish
description: Black rockfish often eat their young, or die trying.

name: Dolphin-Fish
description: With an average IQ of over 185, even the dumbest dolphin-fish is much smarter than you.

name: Kingfish
description: The kingfish is king in name only, but still rules what he can with an iron fin.

name: Canary Rockfish
description: These fish are commonly used in underwater coalmines to warn of impending danger.

name: Sea Bass
description: Now you sea bass, now you don't.

name: Chub
description: A notorious sponsor of public television, the Chub fish will eat nearly anything under any conditions.

name: Wahoo
description: During spawning season, the ocean fills with wahoo up the wazoo.

name: Vermillion Rockfish
description: Each of these unique fish is one in Vermillion.

name: Dag Dag
description: Also known as Dum Dum fish, the Dag Dag is slow and stupid fish that tastes like a tire fire.

name: Talang Queenfish
description: Talang, Talang, Talang went to queen fish. Ring, ring, ring went to shell.

name: Sculpin
description: Sculpins are natural truants who often ditch their school to hang out with the "cool" fish.

name: Pompano
description: The pompano fish is toothless, with a blue stout, scaring absolutely no one.

name: Toehead Shark
description: The toeheaded shark is a bellicose oaf that kills its prey by telling long and boring stories that go nowhere.

name: Monkfish
description: Every monkfish takes a lifelong vow of silence, which is why you'll never hear one speak.

name: Llamafish
description: The differences between llamas and llamafish are too numerous to list.

name: Yellowfin Tuna
description: Tuna are massive fish, often weighing up to 400 pounds, and hard to fit in little cans.

name: Tiger Shark
description: The tiger shark will eat nearly anything, including fish, seals, and potato salad that has been in the sun too long.

name: Marlin
description: This massive fish uses its spearlike snout to emphasize important points during market presentations.

name: Moonfish
description: After a long day of hiding under rocks, the night belongs to moonfish.

name: Sandbar Shark
description: When the shark hits the sandbar scene, every hour is happy hour.

name: Smallmouth Bass
description: Bass are self-conscious about their mouth size, so don't make things worse by staring.

name: Whitetip Shark
description: Most sharks would kill to have white tips, but this one doesn't have to.
